fields.description:
Problem Definition
The "Flagged" field is not shown if the issue is not checked as 'flagged' because Jira does not display fields with 'null' values.

Suggested Solution
Make it possible to display the "Flagged" field even if the issue is not marked as flagged, so it is possible to check or uncheck directly from the issue view, instead of going to "edit issue".

Why this is important
Enhance the user and admin experience. Should avoid the extra hassle of having to click more times to reach the same tool.
fields.summary: Flagged field - Issue view

fields.description:
Actually, when typing a wrong Atlassian URL in a web browser, there is only a message saying that "Your Atlassian Cloud site is currently unavailable. Please check Atlassian Status for known problems ..." There are no mean to know if the Atlassian URL is maybe wrong/doesn't exist.
Like reaching https://dfsdfwfwef.atlassian.net/, a message saying that this URL doesn't exist within Atlassian Cloud instead of "currently unavailable" could make sense and will be more friendly to customers informing that this site URL doesn't exist and inviting him to create this site or there is no needs to wait for its availability.
fields.summary: Add specific error message with details on whether or not an Atlassian site exist instead of currently unavailable

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Trying to associate or dissociate certain fields to screens throws a 500 error

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an independent (Agility) project, and also any other software or business project.
# Go to instance settings > Issues and access the *Field configurations* section.
# Select a field, for example, *Attachments*, and try to associate or dissociate this field from the project screen:
 !associate-screen.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The field is associated/dissociated successfully from the desired screen.

h3. Actual Results
You got a 500 error with the following stacktrace:
{code}
Referer URL: https://<instancename>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/AssociateFieldToScreens!default.jspa?fieldId=attachment&returnUrl=ViewIssueFields.jspa

com.atlassian.jira.scope.IllegalScopedEntityArgumentException: Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (SCREEN). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'
com.atlassian.jira.scope.IllegalScopedEntityArgumentException: Illegal Entity Scope for Entity class (SCREEN). Expected entity scope 'GLOBAL' but has scope 'PROJECT'
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:150) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.scope.EntityScopeUtil.assertGlobalScope(EntityScopeUtil.java:137) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.DefaultFieldScreenManager.removeFieldScreenLayoutItem(DefaultFieldScreenManager.java:183) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.FieldScreenLayoutItemImpl.remove(FieldScreenLayoutItemImpl.java:69) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.FieldScreenTabImpl.removeFieldScreenLayoutItem(FieldScreenTabImpl.java:186) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.FieldScreenImpl.removeFieldScreenLayoutItem(FieldScreenImpl.java:145) [classes/:?]
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.admin.issuefields.screens.AssociateFieldToScreens.doExecute(AssociateFieldToScreens.java:59) [classes/:?]
	at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:165) [webwork-1.4-atlassian-30.jar:?]
{code}
 
h3. Notes
- On further tests, noticed that this behavior occurs on fields which are common or related to normal and independent projects, for example, *Attachments*, *Priority*, *Epic Link*, *Linked Issues* or *Labels*.
- If you try to associate/disassociate a field which is not common/related to both project types, like *Due Date* for example, you got no errors.
- The problem persists as long the independent project exists.

h3.Workaround
Access the project you want and add/remove the desired field accessing the *Screens* section
or
Delete the existing Agility projects
fields.summary: Trying to associate or dissociate certain fields to screens throws a 500 error

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira creates tokens when searching for text fields. 
 For a case like A-B-C Jira can create *three different tokens* or Jira can keep these three words as *only one token*. The same behavior happens for the pattern A-B, where sometimes creates two separated tokens and other times creates only one token.

Since Jira will try to match the words used on the JQL with each token, and Jira can create tokens differently in each case, that's the reason why sometimes a JQL works for one case but not for another case.
h3. Update (April 26, 2021)
Any custom Text Type custom field also is affected.

h3. Update (April 3, 2020)

Summary search is affected as well.

Searching for *!~* is also impacted:
 * Issues with summary: *something*, *test - test*, *test*;
||JQL||Result||
|summary !~ "test - test"|returns all issues(x)|
|summary !~ "test"|(/)|

h3. Environment
 - JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create New project
 # Create test tickets
 ** *Description*: release-abc
 # Go to issue navigator: https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/issues/?jql=
 # Conduct the following test using Advance JQL

||JQL||Result||
|description ~ "release-abc"|(x)|
|description ~ "-abc|(x)|
| | |
|description ~ "abc"|(/)|
|description ~ "release"|(/)|
|description ~ "release-"|(/)|

(x) = Issue not found
 (/) = Issue found
h3. Expected Results
 * Find issues with description matching the JQL

h3. Actual Results
 * Two scenarios where results did not populate correctly

!image-2018-04-02-15-46-19-364.png|thumbnail!

!image-2018-04-02-15-46-19-424.png|thumbnail!

!image-2018-04-02-15-46-19-532.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes
 * Quick Search also displays same results:
 ** https://<EXAMPLE>.atlassian.net/secure/QuickSearch.jspa?searchString=release-abc > (x)

h3. Workaround
 * Using specific text search might work for some cases:
 ** summary ~ "\"test - test\""
 ** summary !~ "\"test - test \""
 It does seem inconsistent sometimes even with an exact search.

 * Also changing the *Indexing Language* under *System Settings* to *English - Moderate Stemming* seem to help.
fields.summary: JQL contains search for a word with hyphen (-) provides incorrect results

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 16 Nov 2018|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

This is a duplicate of JRACLOUD-69254. Please follow along with that issue for further updates.

Cheers,
Eric
{panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Trello importer tool in Jira Cloud hits Trello's API rate limit causing the bug tracked as JRACLOUD-69254
h3. Suggested Solution

Adjust the Trello importer in Jira so that it doesn't hit Trello's limit of 300 requests per 10 seconds for each API key and 100 requests per 10 second interval for each token.
h3. Why this is important

Users with a large amount of Trello are unable to import data from Trello in to their Jira instance due to rate limits documented at [https://developers.trello.com/docs/rate-limits]
fields.summary: Rate limit requests to Trello during import

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Re-ordering statuses in Jira Cloud can be time consuming as each manual up arrow click triggers a page reload. 

To workaround this in Jira Server, administrators can re-order the statuses via database modification as per [How to re-order statuses|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-re-order-statuses-675385085.html]

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow drag and drop in re-ordering statuses or add options like ordering by status category.

h3. Workaround
Go to: Admin > Issues > Statuses > [reorder the statuses]

Refer to [Configuring statuses, resolutions, and priorities|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/configuring-statuses-resolutions-and-priorities-776636333.html] for more detail.
fields.summary: Easier re-order of Statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using issue-detail view (from a board) one is not able to set a time estimate by clicking the field and inputting a value, if "Legacy Mode" is enabled in the time tracking configuration

 
h3. Environment
 * *Only happens if new issue view is enabled*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable "Legacy Mode" under time tracking global configuration
 # Go to a scrum board and click on an issue
 # Edit the field by clicking and adding a value

h3. Expected Results

Value be inserted on the field normally

 Actual Results

Value is removed and defaults to "none"
h3. Notes

Check [video|https://screencast-o-matic.com/watch/cFeU3tDCfA] 
h3. Workaround

Turn off new issue view
OR
Disable legacy mode for time tracking
fields.summary: Can't set time estimate using issue-detail view if Time tracking is in Legacy mode and New Issue View is enabled

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Jira Service Desk customers only cannot create issues via mail handler to Software projects.

h3. Environment

Mail handler to Jira software projects.

h3.Steps to reproduce

# Create a Service Desk project and add a customer;
# Create a software project and configure a mail handler with default reporter to it;
# From the customer email, try to create a ticket for the software project.

h3. Expected results

The ticket should be created in the default reporter's name since the customer doesn't actually have a JIRA license.

h3. Actual result

Ticket is not created and a license error message is shown.
{code}
2018-03-28 14:30:50.611	WARN	com.atlassian.mail.incoming.mailfetcherservice	Create a new issue of add a comment to existing[10101]: Cannot create issue due to invalid license: [Sorry, you can't create any issues right now, as you need to have access to a Jira application to be able to create issues. To gain application access you need to be a member of a group assigned to an application.]	 	 
2018-03-28 14:30:50.581	INFO	com.atlassian.mail.incoming.CreateOrCommentHandler.3	With mail lock ON, start handle message with message-id: <CAG=JWj4EgyVwkoedPbdx4dinyQuZArtQWz9i3g6X3-HRDQD-9Q@mail.gmail.com>	 	 
2018-03-28 14:30:50.581	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler	No Issue found for email 'Atlassian Test 3' - creating a new Issue.	 	 
2018-03-28 14:30:50.580	INFO	com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler	Issue Key not found in subject 'Atlassian Test 3'. Inspecting the in-reply-to message ID.
{code}

h3. Workaround

None.
fields.summary: Portal only customers can't create issues via mail handler

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Cascading custom fields are exporting only the first value of the second option when exporting the issues to CSV.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a cascading custom field and add some values to it, for example:
* A
** 1
** 2
** 3
* B
** 4
** 5
** 6
* C
** 7
** 8
** 9
# Create some issues and set values for them.
# Export these issues to CSV (include the cascading field in the export)

h3. Expected Results
The CSV exporter will export the issues with their correct value

h3. Actual Results
The CSV always export the first value of the second option of the cascading field. For example.
If we have an issue with the value *B-5* and another with the value *A-3*, Jira will export them in the CSV as *B-4* and *A-1* which is the first value in the second option of the field.
 
h3.Workaround
N/A
fields.summary: Cascading field is exporting wrong values when exporting issues to CSV

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently when creating a service desk project with shared permissions set to another service desk project the only thing copied over from the other project is the permission, workflow, issue type and other schemes from an existing project which is expected.

h3. Suggested Solution

Enhance the shared permissions pre-set to copy over other relevant information from the service desk projects such as queues and SLA's.

h3. Why this is important

Many times a team has a central service desk project which they have most of their configuration and when starting a new service desk project they want to bring over their SLA, Automation and queues configuration instead of starting from scratch.
fields.summary: Enhance the shared permissions feature for service desk projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Editing the issue through the Backlog view breaks the auto-linking.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Opt-in to the new Jira issue view, if disabled;
# Insert reference to an existing issue on the description or comment;
# Access the backlog view of the project and open the issue in the side view;
 !backlog-view.png|thumbnail! 
# Edit the issue.

h3. Expected Results
The link to an existing issue should be rendered like in the image below:
 !issue-link.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
All the previously inserted links are converted to web links:
 !issue-web-link.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
- Additionally, if you try to insert a valid issue key while editing the issue in the backlog view, this issue key is not converted to an issue link.
- In certain cases, valid links are not rendered in the backlog view, although they are visible in the full issue view.

h3.Workaround
Disable the Labs feature in the user profile settings.
fields.summary: Editing the issue through the Backlog view breaks the auto linking

fields.description:
Hi everyone,

I’m in a project in which we are creating an iOS consumer application. Our developers using Jira with a development board which shows the active sprint and backlog.

For our design team I’ve also created a board because I want to keep track of all the customer journeys and prioritize pain-points and bugs we need to fix before going live.

Is it possible on the “design” board I’ve made to have my own custom swimming lanes and put the connecting user stories and bugs in a swimming lane (e.g. SignUp or Pair Fitnesstracker) and then prioritize them in a swimming lane? I basically don’t want to do anything with our development board and just have a different view on the user stories and bugs.
fields.summary: Design board with own swimming lanes and priortization

h3. Actual Results
Nothing is happening with keyboard shortcuts and the paste option is not available in the mouse right-click menu.
 With Chrome:

With IE:
 !IE.png|thumbnail!

Save the image file and use the attachment dialog box or the drag&drop

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the new JIRA User Interface, some elements will not show up if your screen isn't enlarged sufficiently. For example, the *Create Project* button will not be displayed inside the Projects page context. The behavior can be seen when shrinking the browser screen little by little until the button will vanish. 

This can lead to confusion in case a user has the habit to access JIRA using a smaller browser screen. Some users can think that they can't create new projects, even with the necessary permissions already in place.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Access JIRA
* Click on the *Projects* link available in the left menu: 
 
!projects.png|thumbnail! 

 !create project.png|thumbnail! 

* Start shrinking the browser window little by little until the button will disappear:

 !shrinking.png|thumbnail! 

 !shrinking - issue.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The should move and be resized dynamically when the screen is resized. 

h3. Actual Results
The button will disappear at some point after starting to shrink the browser screen.

h3. Tested In

* Chrome Version 65.0.3325.181 (Official Build) 
* Firefox Quantum 59.0.2
fields.summary: In the new JIRA UI, consider to dynamically move and resize web elements when a browser screen is resized

This can lead to confusion in case a user has the habit to access JIRA using a smaller browser screen.
fields.summary: The Supported Browsers documentation page should mention what's the minimum resolution required

fields.description:
h3. Summary

*This only happens if you have a user that is using your mail server email and have your mail handler using CC Assignee*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a JIRA project
# Set the default assignee in the project details page
# Create and configure both of your mail server and mail handler for that project.
_Ensure that your mail handler has the CC Assignee set to true_
# Create a user with the email being used by your mail server
# Send a test mail to the email server 

h3. Expected Results

The issues created through email should use the project default assignee.

h3. Actual Results

The issue is created without using the default assignee and instead, it uses the user with the email from your the mail server as assignee.
 
h3. Notes

This shouldn't happen as the email messages are being sent TO the mailbox and not having it as a CC.

h3.Workaround

Either disable the CC Assignee option from your mail handler or if possible delete the user using your POP/IMAP mail server email.
fields.summary: Mail handler not respecting the default assignee of projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a project has 2 workflows associated to different issue types, *Workflow A* associated to *Issue type A*, and *Workflow B* associated to *Issue type B*. It is not possible not edit the issue type from *A* to *B*, the only way to do it is by *Moving* the issue. However, this can be overwritten by using CSV import, to update the issue type, and will break the workflow(Can't transition issue).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have 2 workflows in a project.
# Associate *Issue type A* to *Workflow A* and associate *Issue type B* to *Workflow B*
# Create an issue, with *Issue Type A*
# Use CSV Import to change the issue type to *Issue Type B*.
# This issue can't transition anymore.

h3. Expected Results
* The CSV importer should validate the workflow and prompt users to update the status

h3. Actual Results
* The CSV Importer will update the issue and break the workflow, preventing users from transitioning this issue.

h3. Workaround
* Use CSV import to revert the issue type, and use the *Move* option to properly move the issue to the desired issue type.

h3. Additional Note
This bug is only affecting issues that are not using *Simplified workflow*.
fields.summary: Updating Issue type using CSV import will break the workflow

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a CSV export includes a cascading select list field, the field value shows incorrect value.

Also, if you add a custom field (select list cascading) in the Card Layout of your kanban board the value is different from the value shown in the issue view (and the value is the same as if you export csv).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a cascading select list with multiple values for both parent and child values.
# Create an issue and select a value for the fields in both parent and child.
# Navigate to the issue navigator and find the issue created. Select the cascading field as a column for the search.
# Export to CSV (current fields).

h3. Expected Results
The CSV export shows the same value as what is found in the issue.
h3. Actual Results
The CSV export shows a different value although the value stored in the database is correct.
 
h3. Notes
The value saved in database is correct and HTML export shows the correct value.

h3.Workaround
* Export the search as HTML and change the file type to .xls/.xlsx from the .html format
* Contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] so they can apply a fix for the export issue.
No workaround for the Card Layout problem at the moment.
fields.summary: CSV export from Issue Navigator and Card Layout  from Boards displays incorrect value for cascading select list field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Nowadays, users are more and more using add-ons to complement Jira functionalities, for site-admins it's tough to know if the add-ons is being widely used or if the project it was used for has been finished and thus the add-ons is not required anymore.

h3. Suggestion

Implement an analytic for Jira admins to follow add-ons usage by endusers.

This is similar to the functionality already provided by Confluence Cloud - Macro Usage.

With such functionality as the above site-admins would be able to manage their sites bills more easily.
fields.summary: Provide analytics for add-ons usage across Jira Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When you logged into JIRA and access Dashboard, you will see a pop-up message:
{quote}
You can access other dashboards, but they're not currently displayed in the Dashboards menu. To display them in the Dashboards menu, add them as favorites in the View all dashboards page. 
{quote}

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the helpful tips.
fields.summary: Remove help tips when viewing Dashboard

fields.description:
h3.Summary

The issue history tab is showing issue resolution and status change twice . This happens when the resolution field is included in a screen with log work field. This will cause the resolution field changes to be shown together with the log work activity. There will be another record of the resolve issue activity from the actual issue resolve action (first one is actually log work activity).

Certain reporting add-ons like EazyBi relies on issue history to generate reports. Having duplicate entries on the history tab can cause inaccuracy to the reports as the add-on retrieve the information directly from issue history.

h3.Steps to Replicate
# Create a screen with log work and resolution field
# Add this screen to the resolve issue transition on a workflow
# Resolve the jira ticket and fill in a value for log work field (1m, 2m ...etc).
# Check to see if there are 2 duplicate issue history records. see if there are 2 mentions of issue resolution changes.

h3.Current Results

Issue resolution and status change is shown twice.

!Untitled.png|thumbnail!

h3.Expected Results

Issue resolution and status change is only shown once.

!image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Issue history showing issue resolution and status change activity twice when logging work and resolving issue in same transition screen

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* A lot of customers in Jira have this application integrated with Confluence, but not necessarily all users will have access to both applications.
* If a customer wants to give read-only access to a Jira ticket for a user who has a valid license only for Confluence, there are only two options nowadays:
** Open the instance to anonymous mode;
** Give a Jira license to this user.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Create a read-only permission in Jira for users who have a valid license only in Confluence.

h3. Why this is important
* By creating this permission, the customer won't need to either open completely its project to the public, neither give a license to another user, or even a group of users, to access Jira.
* With this middle level of permission, only Confluence users of an instance (which has Jira and Confluence integrated) will be able to view the issues created in a Jira project.
fields.summary: Create a read-only permission group in Jira for Confluence users

fields.description: Add an "On Hold" (work stops) option for when priorities change and work on the issue stops to work on a more pressing issue and provide a means to "Resume" (Resume to the original status) work to the same status the issue was in when the issue was placed in the status "On Hold".
fields.summary: Create an "On Hold" status and a "Resume" transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary  

The new feature Re-Invite users pop-up displays on every admin page, even after being dismissed. Also appears after every refresh.

There are multiple users who have not and will not accept the invitation for at least another week or two. Admin is aware they haven't responded and does not need a pop up continuously reminding them of this.

Please allow the popup to be dismissed permanently or until new users are added. Or the option to disable.
h3. Environment

Vertigo
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have users that have not accepted an invitation within 7-30 days
 # Go to Site Administration
 # Notice on every page a popup is displayed warning you that you have users that have not accepted the invitation
 # Dismiss the popup
 # Navigate to another admin page or even refresh, the popup displays again

h3. Expected Results

After dismissing the popup it should not reappear. Possibly for a fixed amount of time. The longer the better, perhaps only display it once per day.
h3. Actual Results

The popup is displayed on every admin screen and after every page refresh. This issue occurs not only in the admin pages, all pages might face this issue.
h3. Notes

New feature Re-Invite
 Note that this popup will continue to appear, even after all users have accepted their invites.

Don't need to have pending invitations.
h3. Workaround

No known workaround
fields.summary: Re-Invite user popup continually displays on admin screens even after being dismissed

fields.description:
The KB article [[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/how-to-change-google-apps-domain-in-atlassian-cloud-instances-691011949.html]] is for users who consider changing their Gsuite domain from "@domainA.com" to "@domainB.com".
h3. Current situation:
 * This article is last updated in 2016. Since then, Atlassian experienced a lot of changes related to users management (Gsuite, SAML, Identity management...) also, apparently, google also experienced changes related to their Gsuite console.
 * Currently, the article requests to disconnect Gsuite which is actually not required.
 * Currently the article does not clarify that for users who has different Atlassian products they just need to make the sync in one product.

h3. Expected situation:
 * To avoid any duplicate users that may be created the steps are described in the following comment:
 ## Access to your jira cloud instance ***.atlassian.net and sync users before doing any change in google side (this will ensure users details are up to date).
 ## You don't need to disconnect Gsuite.
 ## You go now to your Google console through [https://admin.google.com|https://admin.google.com/]
 ## You add and verify the new domain as shown in the screenshot below. [[https://support.google.com/a/answer/7502379?hl=en]]
 ## !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!
 ## You then need to update users emails as shown in the screenshot below
 ## !screenshot-3.png|thumbnail!
 ## After finishing all users, you wait 10 minutes then get back to your Jira cloud instance and you Gsuite sync again.
 ## !screenshot-4.png|thumbnail!
 ## Users will now be able to connect to any of the products using their new email address and their old password.

h3. Note:
 * As I already specified these steps will update the Atlassian account which will provide access to the different products.
 * Users who will try later to access with the old email address will not be able to, the access is possible only with the new domain email address.
 * All the history is under the same Atlassian Account accessible through the new domain email address.
* Warning: If the email address mapped to the new domain already exists in the cloud instance, their old account's email address will be modified to  username+conflict@domainB.com.
* You don't need to set the new domain as primary domain.
fields.summary: outdated google domain change documentation

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Depending on a situation, if we have a user who's been renamed, the toolkit may get the user key for the old user, which won't exist in crowd:

This lies at {{getStringFromSingularObject(Object obj)}} it calls:
{code}
userConverter.getDbString((ApplicationUser) obj);
which calls the UserConverter
public String getDbString(ApplicationUser user) {
return user == null?"":user.getKey();
}
{code}

It will return as 'key' the original name, which is not present in Crowd, as it holds the new key.

A specific problem is that this may cause some transitions to fail in Service Desk.

The transition may also fail in the following situation:

* There is a Toolkit field in a transition screen (for example Last updater or commenter)
* A user who had the username edited tries to run this transition using REST API

Result: A 500 error is thrown and the transition is not completed.

You'll see this error in Jira logs:

{code}
Caused by: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.FieldValidationException: User 'xxx' was not found in the system.
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.converters.UserConverterImpl.getUser(UserConverterImpl.java:50)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
at com.atlassian.plugin.util.ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.invoke(ContextClassLoaderSettingInvocationHandler.java:26)
at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy652.getUser(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
at com.atlassian.plugin.osgi.bridge.external.HostComponentFactoryBean$DynamicServiceInvocationHandler.invoke(HostComponentFactoryBean.java:136)
at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy652.getUser(Unknown Source)
at com.atlassian.jira.toolkit.customfield.AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType.getSingularObjectFromString(AuthorOfLastUpdateOrCommentCFType.java:52)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.CalculatedCFType.getValueFromCustomFieldParams(CalculatedCFType.java:65)
at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.ImmutableCustomField.updateIssue(ImmutableCustomField.java:1127)
... 349 more
{code}

If the same user tries to run the same transition through the UI instead of using REST API the error doesn't happen.

h3. Environment
Problem found in JIRA Cloud.

h3.Partial Workaround
Disable JIRA toolkit.
fields.summary: Toolkit may cause transition error with user if renamed

fields.description:

For example: validate if the Original estimate > 0.
fields.summary: Add transition validators for Original estimate and Remaining estimate

fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you add the time tracking field to the screen, and add the Log work field in another tab in the same screen, the Remaining estimate field will be displayed in the same tab as the Log Work.

 

Environment

Jira Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In the edit screen, add the *Time Tracking* field;
 # Create a new tab in the same screen, and add the *Log Work* field in it;
 # Check the screen when accessing the issue now (while editing) that the *Remaining estimate* field won't be displayed with the *Original estimate* field, but with the Log Work field in the other tab.

h3. Expected Results
The remaining estimate field should be displayed in the same screen with the original estimate field.

h3. Actual Results
The remaining estimate field is displayed in the other tab.

h3. Workaround

Have both Time tracking and Log work in the same tab.
fields.summary: New tab will impact the time tracking field

fields.description:

Create a way to sort Two Dimensional Filters Statistics gadget by the workflow status natural order.

h3. Workaround
None

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I would like to see the URL in one line, since there are spaces available to display it this way. Currently the URL is being broken in two lines.

 

I've created a custom field and inserted an URL in its text field. The URL breaks in two lines, but I'd like to see the URL in one line.
fields.summary: Expand URL fields in order to allow URLs to be seen in one line, not in two

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Currently there is no way to change the start of the week day in the Jira Issue Calendar, it is always Sunday.

It would be useful to have the option to configure this to suit your requirements.

Perhaps it would make sense for the calendar to respect the Look and Feel setting for the Date Picker *Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker*.

h3. Environment
Vertigo

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add Jira Issue Calendar to a dashboard
# Notice there is no option to adjust the start of the week day

h3. Expected Results
The Jira Issue Calendar should have its own configuration option or respect the *Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker* setting. I realise this is specifically for the Date Picker, but if the customer wishes to use ISO8601 for the Date Picker it makes sense all other calendars should use the same format.

h3. Actual Results

The start of the week is always a Sunday.
 
h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No workaround known
fields.summary: Ability to edit the start of week day of the Jira Issue Calendar

fields.description:
Currently, there are no information for how we can use the search box(the one in the screenshot below) in Scrum/Kanban boards.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/what-is-a-board-764477964.html

 !Search box.png|thumbnail! 

If we switch to the [Server version|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwareserver/what-is-a-board-938845235.html], we can find the following description
bq. Type part of the issue summary (issue key, issue type) to search for matches to be displayed on the Backlog.
Though, strictly speaking, this is not applicable to Cloud version(in Cloud version, you can search for assignees too).

Since there are less information for this feature in the product itself, I suggest that we need more description for this function in the document for Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In _General Configuration_, *Product recommendation* is set to OFF by default, and users are still receiving a recommendation for Jira Service Desk in the application navigator.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to *General Configuration*

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

fields.description:
I, as Jira Admin, would like to be able to customize the system fields.

For example, modify the "Story Point" field, from a text box to a drop-down list.
Other fields that I would like to be able to edit would be "Fix/Versions", "Affects version/s".

fields.description:
Ultimately I should be able to order the shortcuts to meet my needs. Typically you I want the most frequented items on the top. However, today the system shortcuts (Summary, Board, Issues, Reports, Components) are fixed. I can sort of arrange the user defined shortcuts that follow the system shortcuts based upon the order in which I create them. But if I want to rearrange those then I have to delete them all and re-add in the new order. :(

A good example of what is driving this is that the default Board is very limited and I rarely use. I opt to create my own Kanban. Business projects don't allow you to locate the Kanban to the project, only your profile so I add a shortcut on the sidebar. If I could rearrange all shortcuts I would push the default Board to the bottom and my Kanban to the top.
fields.summary: As an Admin I would like the ability to rearrange the project sidebar shortcuts including the system shortcuts

fields.description:

In Old issue view: Inline attachment linking fails when a square bracket is present in the filename.

Vertigo

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Site-admins should be able to delete addon users which are not longer in use

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install any add-on. A new system user will be added with the name addon_atlassian*
 # Un-installing the addon will not remove the addon user created in the step 1.
 # Due to one of the [Restricted functions in Jira Cloud applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/restricted-functions-in-jira-cloud-applications-776636921.html], site-admins are not allowed to delete any system users

h3. Expected Results
Addon user should be deleted automatically or hidden completely so that they will not show-up in the drop down list when try to at mention a user.

h3. Actual Results
* Addon users are not deleted automatically when the addon is un-installed.
* Addon users are showing up in the drop down list whenever at mention any user.

h3. Notes
If your Issues were mistakenly assigned to these add-on accounts, running this query should find them:
* {{assignee in membersOf("atlassian-addons-admin") OR reporter in membersOf("atlassian-addons-admin")}}
fields.summary: Site-admins should be able to delete addon users which are no longer in use

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Admins have the option to delete a mail Server or mail handler but there is no option to recover the deleted content.

h3. Problem
Customers want to disable incoming mail server so they delete it. There is no option to disable Incoming Email.
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-68296
Note: the global settings at /secure/admin/GlobalMailSettings.jspa only work for other Mail Server and handlers configured.

h3. Customer Impact
They are unable to set incoming email after deleting the default mail server and need to contact support.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to /secure/admin/IncomingMailServers.jspa
# Delete "POP Mail Server" with "Host: Mailstore"

h3. Expected Results
There is an option to reconfigure the default mail server

h3. Actual Results
There is no option to reconfigure the default mail server. To do so, admins will need to contact support.

h3. Proposed solution
Include an option to disable incoming email and remove the option to delete the mail server and handler

h3. Workaround
To manually restore the Default Mail Server:
# Click on Add POP / IMAP mail server
# Enter the information below:
 !Screen Shot 2017-12-20 at 11.38.17 AM.png|thumbnail! 
{quote}
(i) Notes:
The button Test Connection will throw errors, which is expected.
The value for username will be jira@<your instance>.atlassian.net.
The password can have any value.
{quote}
fields.summary: Deleted default Mail Server can't be restored - remove option

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The date time picker does not display the time if you use the *(Shift-)Click or drag* command.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have a Date Time field set on the issue - The problem is also reproducible in the Log Work dialog, since there is a date time field.

h3. Expected Results

Time is displayed correctly on the calendar:
!date-time-visible.png|thumbnail!
h3. Actual Results

While you are dragging to pass through the values, the field is blank:
!date-time-broken.png|thumbnail!
h3. Notes

The problem is not reproducible in the old Jira UI
h3. Workaround

None.

fields.description:
Currently, the process to send a workflow from one instance to another is to:
# Export a workflow as .jwb
# [Upload the exported workflow to Atlassian Marketplace|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/knowledge-base/how-do-i-import-a-workflow-into-a-jira-cloud-instance/])
# Import workflow from the marketplace

This is quite overwhelming, mainly when you're moving from an instance with a substantial amount of workflows.

h3. Suggestion
Allow users to (single file or bulk) import workflows directly into the instance without first uploading it to the marketplace.
fields.summary: Simplify the workflow export/import process between instances

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When deleting an issue from the issue detail view of a board (Backlog, Active Sprint, Kanban or Business), the page will redirect somewhere else in the project after deleting the issue. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

- Delete an issue from the issue details view of a board.
-  !delete.png|thumbnail! 
- Confirm the delete operation.

h3. Expected Results

The page should redirect back to the board. 

h3. Actual Results

The page redirects somewhere else in the project and the user has to navigate back to the board manually.
 
h3.Workaround

For Software Boards (Scrum and Kanban), the new jira issue view can be disabled via 

*Avatar > Profile > Disable New JIRA Issue View*
fields.summary: Deleting an issue from a board will redirect somewhere else in the project

h3. Notes

h3.Workaround
No workaround identified.

fields.description:
Jira Cloud and Confluence Cloud logins are not redirecting some users back to their desired pages due to a regression. 

Example for Jira:
1: Not logged in user tries to visit Jira ticket
2: That user is redirected to login
What should happen:
3: After login that user is redirected back to the Jira ticket they were trying to access

What is happening occasionally instead:
That user is being redirected back to the root of the site. 

Technically, what's happening is that Jira is passing back two 'dest-url' query params to the login endpoint, which is unsupported behaviour.

Here's one of the example bad redirects:
https://example.jira.com:443/login?redirectCount=1&dest-url=%2Fbrowse%2FBOB-3359https://id.atlassian.com/login?continue=https://example.jira.com/login?redirectCount=1&dest-url=%2Fbrowse%2FBOB-3359 

We started noticing this in early January, but it may have been around sometime before then. It is likely a regression.
fields.summary: Login redirect is broken in some situations

For support team where agents are spread worldwide, it would be great to have an option to assign the ticket to team based on the time the ticket was raised.

fields.description:
When you write a comment in a task and provide a @receiver, then that person get the comment as an email. If the person then answer the email, the email answer in inserted into the task its full glory with previous comments. The embedded/attached files become attachments to the task.

The result is that you lose the overview of all comments and you do not see the important attachments among all new attachments.

Suggest that the email answer is cleaned up before turned into a comment in the task.
Also suggest that attached/embedded files in the email are not imported as attachments to the task.
fields.summary: Email response to task comment is ugly

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When attempting to view or download an attachment with  '[' or ']' characters in the file name, we get *Ouch! We can't load the image / PDF* error or an error 500-page containing *"java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character in path at index"* in the technical details.


{quote}
[Test]-FileName
Tes[t]-FileName
[Test-FileName
Test]-FileName
{quote}
 
h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload any file that has a '[' or ']' in the file name.
 # Try to view or download the attached file.

h3. Expected Results
The attachment should be opened or downloaded without throwing any error.

h3. Actual Results
* When trying to view the file, the 'Ouch! We can't load the image/PDF' error appears.
* When trying to download the file, we get a 500 error:

 !500 error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Rename the attachment file name (with chars '(' or ')') and upload to JIRA tickets.
fields.summary: Can't view/download attachments with a '[' or ']' character in the file name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently Jira Cloud only imports users from JIRA Internal Directory. So it's unable to import users managed at Crowd Server.

h3. Suggested Solution

Support import feature from Crowd Server for users and groups.

h3. Related KB
https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/importing-from-jira-server-application-to-jira-cloud-application-throws-an-unsupported-crowd-directory-error-779160730.html

h3. Workaround

# Migrate users from Crowd to JIRA Internal Directory
# Take a site backup on Jira Server
# Restore the backup data on Jira Cloud
fields.summary: Support user import from Crowd

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As a user, I want to be able to choose between an *AND* keyword or *OR* keyword when more than one quick filter option is selected. 

As an example: I have a quick filter to get issues where the *Epic Link = PROJ-1* and another one to get issues where the *Epic Link = PROJ-2*, I want to be able to select both quick filter and have issues related with the two epics. 
The actual result is null.

h3. Suggested Solutions
Create a button or a checkbox on the backlog view, where we can choose between gather the quick filter using an AND or a OR keywords.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to choose between an AND keyword or OR keyword when more than one quick filter option is selected.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
After the implementation of new JIRA experience, we noticed the slowness on IE 11.

h3. Customer Impact
* Impact the operations due to the slowness and even timeout.

h3. Environment
* JIRA Cloud
* IE 11

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On IE 11, try to
# Access JIRA
# Navigating to Project, then straight to a Board
# Navigating to Search then ‘View all issues’ (returns all 29,700 issues)
# Clicking bulk change

h3. Expected Results
* All pages should load smoothly on IE 11.
* All browsers should have the same performance.

h3. Actual Results
* Entering took JIRA 80 Seconds
* Viewing project hangs for several tries and loaded 17.9 Seconds. Boards took 278 seconds with ERROR Timeout prompt error
* Search took 121 seconds 
* Bulk change took 172 seconds

h3. Notes
Tested with Google Chrome on the same machine, everything is loading smoothly. 

h3.Workaround
* Use a different browser
fields.summary: Performance Issue on IE 11 after JIRA New Experience

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When placing a [numbered list|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=lists] into a JIRA issue, the list will display a different behavior depending on where the issue is being displayed.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a numbered list with deeper indentations (###) inside an issue's description. E.g.:
{code:java}
# Item 1
## Sub Item
### Sub-Sub-Item
### Sub-Sub Item
## Sub Item
## Sub Item
# Item 2
## Sub-Item 
## Sub-Item
# Item 3
{code}

 # (/) Correct behaviour - Access the issue by navigating to: *JIRA* -> *Projects* -> _(select project)_ -> *Board*
 # (!) Incorrect - Access the issue by navigating to: *JIRA* -> *Projects* -> _(select project)_ -> *Issues* -> *All Issues* -> _Select Issue_
 # (!) Incorrect - Access the issue by accessing the issue's URL directly: [https://yourinstance.atlassian.net/browse/] \{Issue-Key}

h3. Expected Results

The behaviour should be consistent and the numbered list should display numbers, letters and then roman numerals in all screens: 
 * *E.g.:* When accessing the issue from the board:
!board view.png|thumbnail!


h3. Actual Results

If the issue is accessed from the issues list screen or /browse route, the list will display only numbers:
 !issue view.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

No workaround available at this time.
fields.summary: Numbered list deeper indentations are presenting an inconsistent behavior on different screens (Board/Issue view)
